title: 110_hr7064
content: The "Cleaner Trucks for America Act of 2008" increases the alternative motor vehicle credit amount for new qualified alternative fuel motor vehicles weighing more than 26,000 pounds from $40,000 to $80,000. Additionally, there is an increase in the credit for certain alternative fuel vehicle refueling properties. The amendment to section 30C of the Internal Revenue Code increases the tax credit for compressed natural gas, liquefied natural gas, or liquefied petroleum gas properties to the lesser of 30% of the cost or $250,000 for properties exceeding $100,000 in cost. The amendment also sets a $30,000 credit for depreciable properties and a $1,000 credit for other cases. This amendment applies to properties placed in service after the enactment of the Act. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include new clauses for business credits related to alternative fuel motor vehicles and compressed natural gas, liquefied natural gas, or liquefied petroleum gas properties. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include new business credits for alternative fuel motor vehicles weighing more than 26,000 pounds. The special rule applies to the credit determined under subsection (a) for certain new qualified alternative fuel motor vehicles. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include new business credits for alternative fuel motor vehicles over 26,000 pounds. A special rule applies to the credit determined under subsection (a) for specific alternative fuel vehicle refueling properties like compressed natural gas, liquefied natural gas, or liquefied petroleum gas. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include new business credits for alternative fuel motor vehicles over 26,000 pounds. A special rule applies to the credit determined under subsection (a) for specific alternative fuel vehicle refueling properties. The limitation for the credit shall not exceed the sum of the regular tax liability plus the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year, reduced by the credits allowable under certain sections. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act.
